Here’s an absolute, overall rank based only on the product pages (formula quality, sulfate-free status, specialization, and brand/pro performance), from best to worst:

1. L'Oréal Paris EverPure Sulfate-Free Moisturizing Shampoo (b56c81f7-ad71-4f0d-97c3-fa3d92e03b8c) – sulfate-free, focused moisturizing, color-safe, strong all-rounder.
2. Redken Color Extend Shampoo (aad453af-5c1a-4dd2-8e55-4ad603c7a98a) – salon-grade, protects color, good care + performance balance.
3. Paul Mitchell Tea Tree Special Shampoo (dde3af42-2a92-427c-a232-74b46727bddf) – professional clarifying/refreshing formula, strong performance but more niche (tingle/tea tree).
4. Dove Intensive Repair Shampoo (0845f634-1677-4529-9c6b-d3db17a0f037) – mass-market but solid damage-repair focus, decent conditioning.
5. Garnier Fructis Grow Strong Shampoo (2146aef8-c3a6-4fe2-80d3-3639212273c9) – strengthening/fortifying, good everyday option but more basic.
6. Matrix Brass Off Blue Shampoo (9c1db5c0-7fec-4f6d-bb39-704349a98e66) – very good at its niche (neutralizing brass) but too specialized to rank higher overall.
7. Herbal Essences Hello Hydration Shampoo (42bac578-1e18-45aa-8bdd-e6965a553101) – strong drugstore hydrator, but dated formula and less sophisticated than higher-ranked options.
8. Pantene 2 in 1 Repair & Protect Shampoo & Conditioner (6dd1cabf-43ce-4200-a562-28ec9a57fd60) – convenient 2‑in‑1, but uses SLS/SLES and compromises on both cleansing and conditioning versus separate products.

1. L'Oréal Paris EverPure Sulfate-Free Moisturizing Shampoo – sulfate-free, color-safe, focused moisture, good INCI for a mass brand.  
2. Redken Color Extend Shampoo – pro-grade, protects color and shine, but with stronger surfactants.  
3. Matrix Brass Off Shampoo – excellent for neutralizing brass in lightened brunettes; very targeted use.  
4. Garnier Fructis Grow Strong Shampoo – strengthening/fortifying, decent everyday formula.  
5. Dove Intensive Repair Shampoo – good damage-care positioning but heavier, more build‑up–prone formula.  
6. Pantene 2 in 1 Repair & Protect – convenient but 2‑in‑1s tend to cleanse and condition less optimally.  
7. Herbal Essences Hello Hydration Deeply Moisturizing Shampoo – very pleasant sensory experience but high in harsh sulfates, more basic.  
8. Paul Mitchell Tea Tree Special Shampoo – great clarifying/tingling feel, but more stripping; best reserved for occasional use, so ranked lower overall.

1. Paul Mitchell Tea Tree Special Shampoo – sulfate-free, salon-grade, scalp-focused, strong reviews/value.  
2. L’Oréal Paris EverPure Sulfate-Free Moisturizing Shampoo – sulfate-free, color-safe, moisture + frizz control.  
3. Dove Intensive Repair Shampoo For Damaged Hair – strong damage-repair positioning, Good Housekeeping award, good everyday option.  
4. Garnier Fructis Grow Strong Shampoo – strength-focused, accessible price, decent ingredients for breakage-prone hair.  
5. Pantene 2 in 1 Repair & Protect Shampoo & Conditioner – convenient 2‑in‑1, good conditioning, but combined step is less customizable.  
6. Herbal Essences Hello Hydration Deeply Moisturizing Shampoo – very hydrating, popular; standard sulfates and silicones, basic care.  
7. Matrix Brass Off Shampoo – excellent but very niche: only for neutralizing brass in lightened brunettes, not general use.  
8. Redken Color Extend Magnetics range page – informational collection page, no single specific shampoo product detailed here to rank on its own.
